_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE WILBUR-ELLIS COMPANY?S ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PROGRAM IS A PRIORITY PROGRAM FOR THOSE FACILITIES HANDLING ACUTELY HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS.  THROUGHOUT WILBUR-ELLIS A COMPREHENSIVE SAFETY PROGRAM IS IN EFFECT WHICH INCLUDES TRAINING, INSPECTIONS, SAFETY MEETINGS AND MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTABILITY.  THIS FACILITY PROVIDES END-USE AGRICULTURAL CHEMICALS IN SEALED CONTAINERS TO DEALERS AND DISTRIBUTORS FOR RESALE, AND DIRECTLY TO GROWERS FOR FINAL USE.  THIS FACILITY ALSO PROVIDES BULK FERTILIZERS.  GIVEN THE FACT THAT THIS FACILITY DOES NOT PROCESS ACUTELY HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.  THIS FACILITY IS COVERED BY OSHA REGULATIONS AND IS VISITED ANNUALLY BY VARIOUS OTHER AGENCIES.  THERE HAVEN?T BEEN ANY ACCIDENTS OR INCIDENTS IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS INVOLVING ACUTELY HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.  OCCASIONALLY JOINT EXCERCISES WITH LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT ARE HELD ONSITE.  THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS REVIEWED AND TRAINED ANNUALLY.  WILBUR-ELLIS SAFETY TRAINING IS AN ONGOING PROCESS EACH YEAR AND EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS PLANS ARE SHARED WITH LOCAL AND COUNTY AGENCIES.



To improve the safety of ammonia and all other aspects of operations, Wilbur-Ellis has implemented a comprehensive, risk-based safety management process to help guide employees to improved safety performance. The safety management process, branded Guiding People to Safety (GPS), is designed to be implemented in four steps, step one comprising of the foundation and fundamental elements of a strong safety program and positive safety culture. The GPS process provides guidelines for each safety program that describe methods for effective implementation. The GPS program includes measures for tracking progress and success and for addressing opportunities for improvement within the process and individual safety programs. These measures include action tracking software to facilitate timely corrections of deficiencies and recommended improvements identified during inspections, audits, and hazard analyses. Wilbur-Ellis is committed to prev

enting incidents cultivating a positive safety culture throughout the company. The mission of our Environmental Health, Safety and Security (EHSS) team is to drive effective results in reducing

incidents and employee injuries by combining the GPS process with a positive safety culture.
